hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1356 a and today's date is
August 15 2017 and the top of the
episode is the central bankers have
become desperate they're asking people
to do the following let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
we're starting to see different
countries pretty much do the same thing
that the United States did as they were
pumping up the illusion
we've gotten to the point where all
these statistical numbers that they're
pushing out they're countering what's
really going on and it's becoming harder
and harder to explain why the economy
isn't doing as well as these numbers say
the economy is doing because think about
it for a second here in the United
States we have retail completely
crashing we know there's a lot of stores
closing a lot of people are losing their
jobs but the corporate media the
government the Fed they're continually
pushing out statistics that everything
is a-okay and when you see stores
closing down in malls in strip malls you
scratch your head and you say what's
going on here and there's many different
ways where they can manipulate all this
I mean if we go back in time where the
United States decided to give cash for
clunkers they were trying to boost the
automobile industry now this was to
create the illusion that things were
going well to get people to purchase
cars and we see Europe they're doing the
same exact thing now Volkswagen a German
car bram announced it will be paying up
to ten thousand euros per your old car
of any brand if you trade it in for a
brand new Volkswagen in Germany and then
just a few days later Opel which is
previously owned by General Motors
but now owned by PSA the French brand
they're doing this same exact thing and
they're offering around 7,000 euros if
they trade in
their old car doesn't matter if it's an
Opel or not doesn't matter what the
brand is as long as you buy a new Opel
so they're doing the same type of
incentive program that the u.s. did
which was called cash for clunkers and
they're trying to boost car sales to
save the failing car industry because
what we're seeing right now is that the
automobile industry they're having a
very tough time now of course does this
really save the industry no it gives it
a little bump up for a little time being
and then everything completely falls
apart afterwards and there's other ways
they can manipulate the numbers just
like here in the United States they like
the channel stuff remember every time
they bring a car onto the lot it's
considered a set a sale it's not when
they sell the car it's when they bring
it onto the lot so they can make the
numbers look fantastic and Ron used to
do incredible accounting tricks where
they made everything look fantastic and
look what happened to them Bernie Madoff
he had a whole Ponzi scheme going people
thought they were making tons of money
but look what happened to him
all of these schemes always come to an
end now what's very interesting the
corporate media the government they came
out and they're telling you how great US
retail sales are in July they just
they're just fantastic
everything rebounded and everything is
going smoothly and very very well now
remember we've had declining two
straight months of US retail sales and
then all of a sudden they're talking
about this point six percent
month-on-month game now this is the most
since December 2016 but this was driven
by a surge in Motor Vehicles because
remember the car companies are trying to
move the cars on the lot because they
Channel stuffed all the lots and what
they're doing is they're giving huge
incentives cash back zero percent
lowering the prices now they did this
prior to 2008 and the car industry got
into trouble they're doing the same
thing right now we also have to look at
the retail sales
and they had been revised away magically
and all of a sudden we see for the last
couple of months where retail sales have
been improving now we need to remember
that a lot of stores they already
started to close there's a lot more that
will be closing and we need to
understand how they calculate retail
sales remember this is an estimate this
isn't the actual numbers that the
retailers put out and from all these
retailers that are closing what the
government likes to do is they like to
take all the declining sales and they
like to spread it out over many many
months so if you have ten stores closing
and the stores just come to a screeching
halt and the sales just come to a
screeching halt they don't say okay
sales are way down they take those
numbers out they massage them and bring
them out over many many months so what
we're seeing right now is this
manipulation of retail sales to make
everyone believe that retail is doing
much much better than it is now
everything rose except for clothing
stores are down by negative point two
percent electronics and appliance stores
they're down by negative point five
percent and gasoline stations they're
down by negative point four percent now
was very interesting a research company
called South Bay Research they're
looking at the numbers and they're
saying something just doesn't sound
right because remember just like two
weeks ago the auto industry their sales
were absolutely awful think about GM
they were down 15% year-on-year Ford was
off by 7% Chrysler down by 11 per site
11% now according to the retail sales
report from the Census Bureau sales for
Motor Vehicles and part stores rose much
more robust robustly than anyone had
anticipated rising 1.2 percent the
fastest paints since December now these
numbers are kind of strange and very
bizarre because they're completely out
of context with readings recent sales
data and South Bay research while they
looked at the numbers and they said this
doesn't even make sense and when you
look at it it really doesn't think about
it
consumer retail spending was actually
mild it didn't improve and they're
wondering where did these numbers come
from and they're saying don't believe
the auto sales data per the be ei unit
sales were completely flat so there's no
rise in auto sales per the real world
and they ve a couple with a fall in debt
prices but in the fantasy land of the
Census Bureau they're making it seem
like everything is fine now South Bay
they have this index called the vise
index and for those who are unfamiliar
with device index attracts US consumer
spending on alcohol marijuana
prostitution gambling vices are a
special form of discretionary spending
that is highly sensitive to near-term
economic conditions one its cash based
depends on free cash flow to luxury
spending once not needs three
significant dollar amount not pricy but
not cheap by spending is broadly
representative of the US consumer and
the reason why this index is a
particular interest is because vices
predict retail spending with a four
month lead luxury spending is the first
thing to be affected by changes in
household finances and when you look at
the index the index is down around
negative two percent which shows that
people aren't going out and they're not
purchasing so these numbers that the
Census Bureau is putting out is once
again fake phony and false they're not
backed up by any type of reality these
are estimates and they're trying to make
it look like because this is what they
expected to happen they wanted everyone
to believe that the retail industry was
doing well but we can see from Dick's
Sporting stores well they're not doing
that well at all now Dick's stocks they
crashed after reporting dreadful results
this morning
they're both comp sales and EPS they
missed as the company slashed its
full-year guidance below even the lowest
sell side forecast and the CEO was out
there and the CEO ed stack he's saying
that they looked at the consumer market
and the consumers have told them that
their prices are not competitive in
today's environment and they need to
lower the prices now what they're going
to have to do is they're going to have
to give deep discounts and this is what
they started to do but we can see right
now that people aren't running out and
purchasing people are looking for deals
why because they don't have the funds to
pay for these expensive items they'd
rather go shopping and they'd rather
find deals when they need to purchase
something so the time of the expensive
stores where they're charging the high
prices that is coming to an end because
as more and more people lose jobs more
more people making less jobs as wages
continually fall guess what happens
people look at dick's they look at maybe
Amazon they look at other retailers and
say you know something I don't need to
spend that much there I can spend it
someplace else and this is what's
happening in these stores are going to
get hurt because their entire model is
built on the cost structure of having
these items at a certain price level and
once they start reducing it guess what
they lose profit and we can see this is
happening across being the entire United
States with the retail sector even with
online because just because it's online
doesn't mean it's cheap I mean I've gone
to Amazon before and I found a product
and I've gone to a store or a
brick-and-mortar store and I found that
Amazon was more expensive than the
brick-and-mortar store so these
retailers today all of them even online
they're going to have to change because
the spending habits of people that is
changing now what's very interesting is
that the Fed now we've talked about this
before there's one thing the Fed can't
make people do that is spend money now
they can
people take loans out well you have to
go to college college is too expensive
take a loan out you want to purchase a
house well take a loan out because you
can definitely not you're not going to
be putting down 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 a million
dollars on a house it's just not going
to happen most of the people don't have
that type of cash if you're going to go
purchase a car you're not going to shell
out 20 30 40 50 thousand dollars for a
new car so you're not most likely not
even going to finance it most people are
leasing today because it's just too
expensive the incomes the wages have not
kept up with the inflation on
automobiles on houses on college tuition
and that's where we are seeing inflation
now what's very interesting is that the
housing bubble right now well it is
started again now I'm going to bring
this all in to what the Fed wants
everyone to do now there's a lot of
people that are purchasing homes with
less than 10 percent down so what
they're looking at right now and this is
coming from Black Knight Black Knight
financial services they're pointing out
that down payments the fairy thing that
is supposed to deter rampant housing
speculation well it's now much easier
for people to go purchase a house
because what they're seeing is about 1.5
million bars have purchased a home with
less than 10 percent down this is a
seven-year high and with housing prices
continually moving up people think wow I
put less than 10 percent down I bought
my house at 200,000 and now it's worth
225,000 because the Fed has been blowing
up the bubble why have they been doing
this because what they want people to do
is they want them to feel good about
their purchase they want people to say
you know something I'm doing well I have
my job and I have my home and my home is
going up in price that's what they're
trying to do and when people feel good
and they see their house you know
appreciating it makes them feel
confident now the Fed wants people to
take that money out of the house said
Dudley well he is saying that listen we
need everyone to tap their home equity
right now real estate has gone up we
don't think it's coming down and you've
made quite a bit of money on your homes
it is now time to tap into the home
equity and go out and purchase goods now
we saw this once before this was in 2008
and a lot of people because of the
appreciation in their homes they felt
very comfortable where they went and
they took a home equity line of credit
they took that money they bought a car
they bought any other type of product a
high ticket item product because they
were able to take the home equity line
out of their house and they were able to
use this someplace else and what
happened later on well everything was a
complete disaster so basically what he's
saying is that your house once again is
an ATM and now is the time to do it why
is he saying it right now because he
knows that there's only a small window
because the housing market is not doing
well and he knows that prices are
starting to fall and he wants people to
go out and to spend to keep the system
operational and this is what the central
bankers do think about what they've been
doing because they're becoming so
desperate that they need to do all these
things they need to offer 0% interest
they need to tell you to take your home
equity line and go spend in retail
they're doing all of these things
because this is the end game right here
they have nothing else to do and the
only way they can get people to spend is
to give them funds and if they if you
tell people you know listen
0% interest go out and get a home equity
line a credit go out and spend your
house is just going to go up in value
everything's going to be great people
most people will say oh okay that sounds
great now what's very interesting about
all of this is that the Fed also issued
a warning that household debt has hit an
all-time new high where they're saying
that the US credit card debt it's
above where it was in 2008 so on one
side of the mouth of the Fed they're
telling us that hey listen it's a great
time to take out another loan on the
other side they're issuing a warning
that US credit card debt is at an
all-time high and this is very
concerning to the Fed because they don't
believe that this debt level can be
sustained well as we can see back in
2008 it couldn't be sustained it was a
complete disaster so this is what it
looks like at the end stage of their
fire system they're flip-flopping back
and forth they're just trying to get
everyone to spend funds to take out more
loans then warning them that we might
have a problem but of course they keep
that part very very quiet and we can see
right now that we are headed toward a
complete and utter disaster
the indicators that we have been looking
at they're all pointing to the same
thing and a lot of them are 10 times
worse than 2008 and we have to remember
this these numbers that were looking at
they're manipulated or massaged they're
fake just like the triple-a rating on

2007 2008 it was fake it was an illusion
to draw people in we're seeing the same
thing once again and they manipulated
the entire economy this time and they're

possibly can and it's going to end in
the disaster this is why you need to be

does
people can say it's not going to until

scurry away and you never hear from

by pretending everything was better by
